intro: Rechsteineria spicata, commonly known as the spike rechsteineria, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Rechsteineria spicata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
